One of the most notorious milestones in the gaming industry. Despite the fact that this game is around 23 years old as of today, and the graphics and physics are well outdated and janky, it's still a really fun and engaging experience from beginning till the end. Any person that likes first person shooters must play this game.

This game was atrocious, even for its time. It was difficult to even play due to it softlocking all the time. As for the gameplay, it's styled like a classic shoot-em-up, but the combat is so awful and paired with even worse movement, you end up basically having to save-scum after you kill *any* enemy at all. Enemy AI is terrible and you can softlock yourself by killing an enemy and having its corpse block doorways/passages. Health regeneration is inconsistent at best and doesn't scale with the difficulty of enemies or number of them. Would not recommend this at all
The game is extremely fun!! I reccomend to anybody who has a computer.

I get the whole idea of not holding the player's hand but there were many MANY times where I was confused on where to go and they ended up being a little tunnel that looks like it wasn't apart of the path the game was going. I don't really know if i can add to the discussion of this game, because anything that could be said about Half-Life right now, has been said. I won't say it's a flawless game - it's not. Models haven't aged the best, NPC AI isn't exactly, well, intelligent, and certain chapters of the game (On a Rail, the Xen chapters) feel like Valve punishing the player for becoming too relaxed while playing the game. But that doesn't mean that Half-Life is a bad game - far from it. Not only did Half-Life introduce world-building and environmental storytelling never seen before in the FPS genre, it introduced a more tactical approach to FPS combat, encouraging smart and quick thinking as opposed to the common "Run into room and blow lead into every moving being". While this may frustrate first time players that are more used to the fast-paced unstoppable game play of, say, Doom or Blood, Half-Life's punishing nature encourages the player to think tactically and logistically, and use all available tools to overcome the challenges they must face.

Overall, Half-Life is an absolute must-play for any FPS fan that provides some of the most engaging and difficult game play ever seen in a video game.

İnternet cafede crossfire mapinde arkadaşlarımızla oynayıp fakat hikaye kısımında tren istasyonundan korkup kapattığımız oyundur. 21 yaşıma geldim hikayesini bitirmek anca nasip oldu. Gerçekten o dönemlere nazaran  çok iyi yapılmış bir oyun . Oynarken  bu dönemde bulunan oyunlarla oyun içine girdiğinizde karşılaştıramıyorsunuz  yani pixel mevzuları kafanıza bile takılmıyor ama amk oyunu ne kadar güzel de desem  de  koca yaşıma rağmen yine korktum . Mapde bulunan o ajanların ben yedi ceddini ...  altıma sıçırttırdı o ne hız lan .
